title: The Hearts of the Warriors

replies.body: Amazing. I thought it was Darius not Talon so well done on that. Though I wonder if Darius was using his day off to practise his axe swinging ;)

Thanks
normally it is Darius vs Garen but Darius doesn't have any connections with Kat other than being from Noxus, where as talon is Kats adoptive brother

the league community ships Garen and Kat because of Garens quotes to her, but I've always thought out of all the champs who realistically could be shipped with Kat whether its purely out of respect for the daughter of the man who saved him or maybe something more talon to me at least fits the bill

im sure Darius wouldn't want Garen to die like that at the end there so its up to the readers to decide who won the fight, though if either died im sure Kat would be sad so is there really a winner in the first place?
Oh no what happens next? D:

This story is legit.

If you fix some of the spelling mistakes I could really get behind this

> As the clash of steal could no longer be heard, replaced with the thud of steal on flesh and a cry of anguish at oneâ€™s own weakness.

I found this particular line at the end incredibly heart wrenching and beautifully phrased; the idea that both Talon and Garen are frustrated that they're not strong enough to be a suitor for Kat. I also enjoy that it's not about the physical epic battle between them, but the emotional battle - the physical one just used as a symbol of their feelings.

Really cool and great work.
